content:
Finding people who share your specific combination of identities and experiences can be challenging, especially if you live in a location where there may not be many people with similar backgrounds. However, there are some strategies you can try to connect with others who share your intersectional identity:

1. Search Online: You can search for online communities or forums that are specifically geared towards intersectional identities. For example, you might search for groups or forums that focus on being an Asian American LGBTQ+ person, or an ex-Christian LGBTQ+ person. You might also search for groups focused on homeschooling or Midwestern culture.
2. Attend Events: Consider attending events that cater to your intersectional identity. For example, you might attend an LGBTQ+ Asian American event or a conference focused on the experiences of ex-Christian individuals. Attendees at these events may share your combination of identities and experiences.
3. Reach Out to Local LGBTQ+ Centers: Many LGBTQ+ centers offer support groups and events for people with specific identities or experiences. You might reach out to local centers and ask if they offer any resources or events that might be relevant to your intersectional identity.
4. Connect with Individuals: While it may be difficult to find large groups of people who share your exact combination of identities and experiences, you may be able to connect with individuals who share some of your identities. Try reaching out to people on social media or through online communities, and see if you can connect with someone who shares your background.

Remember that it may take some time and effort to connect with others who share your intersectional identity. Don't be discouraged if it takes time to find people who understand your experiences.
